intro: Helicteres dentata var. procumbens, commonly known as the prostrate helicteres, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a shrub that typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features compound leaves with serrated edges and produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its botanical structure includes a woody stem with adventitious roots, and it is characterized by its prostrate growth habit. The species is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar morphological traits.
